intro: Drosanthemum autumnale, commonly known as the autumnal drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces vibrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. Its foliage consists of fleshy, lobed leaves that store water, aiding in its survival in dry conditions. Drosanthemum autumnale is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
